data.title: Nice small park
data.text:
My husband was running a race which started and finished at this park
While I was waiting for him to finish I had a wander around, there is a nice walk along the front, with a small jetty out over the water
There is a small children's play area, there are also some sculptures and water features too
There is plenty of parking, it is also close to down town Fort Myers so you could do both the park and down town
Nice place to sit and watch the world go by

data.title: Taste Of Lee Event Nov 5 2016
data.text: Nice afternoon for couples and/ or families  marina's all around. Saturday they hosted an event called 3rd annual "taste of Lee"  Probably 2 dozen local vendors from local restaurants,  live music.  The park is located in the downtown area and was a nice day.  The cost was $5 per person and food varied, you needed to buy coupons but not bad on the prices.  Good way to experience a variety of the local foods.

data.title: Great For Romantic Evening Walks
data.text:
Great for romantic evening walks along the water!  Pathways take you along the Caloosahatchee River where you can enjoy stunning sunsets and evening breezes.  This park has loads of features including:  art sculptures, fountains, benches, shelters with picnic tables, sand volleyball court, children’s playground, bathrooms and open grassy areas for playing Frisbee or having a picnic.

Last Sunday we enjoyed the drum circle and I’ve heard great things about the Thursday Farmer’s Market and hope to check it out soon.

Why only 4 out of 5?  At the moment, a big portion of the pathways and access along the water is blocked, while they make some changes to that area.  This makes some parts of the park congested and trickier to navigate.  Once they have this area finished, it will be back to 5 for sure.

data.title: Nice riverview park
data.text:
Nice park with a good view of the Caloosahatchee River. Lots of picnic tables, clean bathrooms, playground for the little ones.
Good for family activities. I have had birthday parties & baby showers there.

data.title: I love this park!
data.text: Centennial Park is well worth the visit.  Beautiful grounds, immaculately kept.  Great place to walk, relax, and take in all that is  Ft. Myers.

data.title: Community Park
data.text: It has been around for years and you can tell. You will find diversity here. You will the some of the best of people and some of the least fortunate. If you do not mind, play away. Lay a blanket down and have a picnic. From a playground, valley ball courts, attractive water fountain, monumental status where you could take 100 photos, a walking trail and the view of the sunset is great! It is a photographers paradise. If you are in Fort Myers, you should stop here to listen to the waves crash along the pier or watch the sunset or run the path to watch the sun rise.

data.title: A breath of green
data.text: Centennial Park on the Caloosahatchee River is a great place to walk, look at current public art, let children play on swings, have a picnic, enjoy an outdoor concert

data.title: Nice to Visit
data.text: If you like to be on the water, this is a place to relax or just take a walk along the river.  Nicely kept, open and clean so taking the grand kids is not an issue especially with the play ground.  The Thursday Farmers Market with a few food trucks is a treat.

data.title: Just a short walk from downtown
data.text: From this park you can see two or three bridges crossing the river. There seems to be some boat tours that start from this park. We did not take any. We walked around under wonderful weather. The park is well kept. It is ample and nice. Recommended.

data.title: Great green space on the Caloosahatchee River
data.text: Located on the Caloosahatchee River and connected to downtown Ft. Myers,  This nice little park is a great place to relax. Walking paths wind you thru various memorials, sculptures and many other sites. Perfect place to catch a sunset or catch some fish rom the dock. Overall park is kept clean has decent bathroom facilities. Feel free to bring a furry friend on a leash. This park also holds many weekend events. My favorite is the drum circle on Sunday evenings. Typically plenty of parking is available.

data.title: Nice Views of the River
data.text: Centennial Park in downtown Fort Myers has a beautiful view of the river.  It has a sidewalk parallel to the river, a beautiful fountain of Thomas Edison, Henry Ford and Harvey Firestone.  There is a playground for children and several covered areas.  Today, I visited a community farmers market that Centennial Park has every Thursday from 8am-1pm.  It was very nice and I will return again.

data.title: A good place for the kids as well as everyone else
data.text: We used to live almost next door to this park and rode our bikes through there almost every day.  There is a wonderful playground for the kids; docks; restrooms; areas to sit in the shade and close to downtown, and events for entertaqinment

data.title: Peaceful and pretty
data.text:
Walking through the park is always a great time however the homeless population is evident. We were approached twice and were asked for money. I didn't mind however as this is a part of life. 

The trees and the park are well maintained. The clocks and palm trees along the street are a very nice touch.

data.title: Alot of Mosquitoes and little spiders
data.text:
I went to this location for a history walk. While waiting for the other guest I sat on one of the benches and I was admiring the statues. To my surprise I saw about 3 spiders in the space of less than 15 mintues. 

I know its florida and they have spiders but just be careful. Other than that I had alot of fun and next time im walking with my "oh Gosh Mosquito Repellent"

data.title: a beautiful place so beautiful my daughter got married there!
data.text: beautiful views! a wharf to walk out on- playground- shaded areas wonderful for reading & relaxing- walkway along the edge of the park which follows the river clean large restrooms & many music events take place here & a lovely wate rfountain with statues

data.title: Nice view
data.text: Nice fountains and water front side walk.  The view of the river and bridges at night time was very nice.

data.title: Cute park with beautiful views downtown
data.text: Gorgeous view of the water and nice green grass. I've actually done a photo-shoot and a wedding here, beautiful shots! There's an area to park your car, and it warns you can only stay for three hours; I've never been towed. Pet friendly too! Although there are no poop stations, so don't forget to bring doggy bags. Lots of kids playing and joggers, very friendly! Vending machines around too in case you're thirsty.

data.title: Love this Park.
data.text: I love centennial Park. They have big open fields to play sports in. Pavilions with outlets installed which are great for parties. The pier has always been very relaxing for me and a trip to the Edison Inventor fountain was a consistent must when  I was a child.

data.title: Relax in downtown along the river
data.text: A pleasant walk along the waterfront. Often the place where concerts, festivals and other special events are held. There's a fishing pier and picnic pavilions, swings for the kids and benches for relaxing in the shade. Great spot for a wedding, prom or anniversary photo too.

data.title: Be careful at night
data.text: This is a nice park during the city events that they hold during the year. At night I would be careful walking around the area, especially if you were just visiting Ft Myers.
